alert.note: Alert for Fergus (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 2:45PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Fergus County through 315 PM MDT... At 244 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles north of Lewistown, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, nickel size hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Roy, Fergus, Suffolk, Hilger and Christina. This includes Highway 191 between mile markers 8 and 36. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
